conclusion: The cylindrical capacitor has height l, inner radius a, outer radius b, constant voltage V, slightly immersed in fluid, no fluid risen yet, dielectric constant κ, initially contains air (dielectric constant ≈ 1).
Determine the capacitance of the cylindrical capacitor with air: C_air = (2πϵ₀l)/ln(b/a).
Calculate the energy stored in the capacitor: U = (1/2)CV².
Final answer: Total energy stored in the capacitor before any fluid rises is U = (πϵ₀lV²)/ln(b/a).
